The objective of this policy is to specify the age and process of retirement of an employee from services of the
This policy is applicable to Berkmeer India Private Limited, subsidiary of Betaine B.V, Netherlands. (Hereinafter
Distribution and Control of this document
This policy is the lay guidelines to attain retirement from services as per the terms and conditions mentioned
in the appointment letter of an employee
The age of retirement of an employee will be on attainment of 58 years, basis the date of birth
declared in the company records at the time of joining.
An employee attaining retirement age will be notified 3 months in advance about the last date of
employment in the company along with notification to all related stakeholders.
Notice Period clause is not applicable to employees who reach the date of retirement.
LDE of a retired employee is computed basis the month in which an employee attains the age 58
years. The retirement date will be the last date of the retiring month.
An employee can choose to retire earlier than the system identified date. Acceptance of the early
relieving is discretionary by the management considering role, business requirements and
- As and when process changes occur
1 Shubhayu Sen Gupta, Aparna Rao Basu & Vidya Babu
@Used under license from Hinduja Global Solutions Limited
The retiring employee is expected to follow the handover process of the roles and responsibilities to
the designated person, assigned by the manager.
Notification of a Retiring employee will be sent to all concerned departments 15 days prior to
Respective departments to declare assets / information upon receiving intimation.
Employee to return all the company assets, clear loans and advances (if any) within 10 days
Upon receiving the assets and dues (if any), respective departments to give a No-Due clearance
within 7 working days. Employee to ensure all dues are cleared before LDE.
Line ER accepts the separation process after completion of exit formalities and Department
Basis clearance from all departments, where there are no dues payable by the employee to
the company, HR department will issue relieving/service certificate.
Line ER will keep the separation process and Final settlement on-hold until the retiring
employee and the manager complete the exit formalities.
The retiring employee is encouraged to plan for financial stability, medical insurance, including taking up
consulting services or other accomplishments of self-interest.
Retiring employee shall contact HR department and apply for retirement benefits like Gratuity,
Ensure you invest in retirement/pension plans to support your financial need post retirement
It is good practice to increase your investments/savings in financial instruments as income
Instead of withdrawing EPF balance when changing jobs, transfer it to the new account
Employee can increase PF contribution through VPF scheme
Plan medical insurance for self and family to support medical needs
Advance plans to pursue personal interests or philanthropic activities
Any deviation to this policy will have to be approved by the India Business Head and India HR Head.
Violations of the above policy guidelines may result in appropriate disciplinary action.
Berkmeer reserves the right to add, delete or modify any clause or any part thereof without assigning
The company reserves the right to interpret the meaning of this policy and/or any part thereof
/supplementary orders issued therein and such interpretation shall be final and binding upon all the
